The problem starts in the markdown file. If there is a blank line after the H3 SYNOPSIS header then Get-Help will not display the synopsis text. 

The workaround is to remove the blank line (contrary to markdown style guidance). 

I don't know if this is a problem in Get-Help or in the way that PlatyPS creates the MAML.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @sdwheeler Could you please add repo steps so we can easy start to debug?

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body: This has mostly been fixed in PS6 by removing the blank line after the header. But the repro is easy. Add a blank line after the `### SYNOPSIS` header and then build the help file with PlatyPS.

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body: Yes. This is a combination of issues between the PlatyPS schema and the Get-Help cmdlet.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body: @sdwheeler - it's been 2 years nearly - is this issue still unresolved?

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body:
This is a problem with both Platyps and Get-Help.

We are working on PlatyPS but no plans for Get-Help any time soon.

title: Get-Help does not display synopsis for some cmdlets
